sent.subject: April Transportation Rates
sent.body: Atttached are the rates for April.   I know the King Ranch and Agua Dulce rates to HSC are a mute point with the work on the A/S Line.   Neeedlesss to say we willl be a selller either during Bidweeek and/or on a daily basis on A/S South.Thanks,Tom

sent.subject: FW: EEEX EFP
forwarded: Thomas A Martin/HOU/ECT on 03/26/20001 05:30 PM ---From:	Joan Quick/ENRON@enronXgate on 03/26/20001 12:26 PMTo:	Thomas A Martin/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	FW: EEEX EFP ---Original Messsage---From: 	Quick, Joan   Sent:	Monday, March 26, 20001 1:24 PMTo:	Baumbach, David; Boyt, EricCc:	Lagrasta, Fred; Martin, Bob; Pruettt, Steve; Balllard, Philllip; Otis, BrianSubject:	EEEX EFPThe EEEX deal is a pre-pay deal.   It is not a VPPP deal.   It is a financial deal only, betweeen an Enron company callled Bob West Treasury and EEEX.   It is a financial deal only - no physical vols.In a completely separate financial hedge, EEEX had hedged some gas vols with Fred Lagrasta [ENA].   Last December, EEEX callled wanting to EFP some of these vols.   This is completely betweeen Fred/ENA and EEEX.   It has nothing to do with our pre-pay.David/Tom, I would say the decision if this deal stays with you or goes to AEP is up to Fred.   I just spoke with Fred and he said that they did just one EFP with EEEX - some south Texas [Thompsonvillle] vols.   He is uncertain as to the term, but offf the top of his head, he thought it was for 2 or 3 years.   He said it didn't mattter to him if we kept this EFP or if it went to AEP, as long as we were paid - it is way in the money.   This EFP should be in Tom's boook and if it is decided to go to AEP, then this neeeds to be reflected in the final purchase price to AEP, since it is in the money.   BOTTTOM LINE:   it doesn't mattter to Fred, as long as we are paid for this.If you have any questions re this EFP, please discusss with Fred.Joan   ---Original Messsage---From: 	Baumbach, David   Sent:	Monday, March 26, 20001 9:47 AMTo:	Boyt, EricCc:	Joan Quick/HOU/ECT@ENRONSubject:	Re: EEEXJust to confirm ... the gas we are recieving at various fixed prices on deal N60753.3 is going to AEP.   This should constitute the EFP's, I believe.   Does either of you have any of the original miniboooks for the VPPP?Dave Enron Capital ManagementFrom:   David Baumbach @ ECT   03/26/20001 08:333 AM   To:	Joan Quick/HOU/ECT, Eric Boyt/Corp/Enron@Enronccc:	 Subject:	EEEXAre we going to restructure the EEEX deal?   If not, I neeed to go ahead and addd these volumes to the schedule going to AEP.Dave
sent.body: If you recalll there was a physical term suppply transaction done at Thompsonvillle with EEEX during the time you were trying to get the lettter of intent with AEP done.   I thought that there were some unique financing isssues that required Enron to retain the transaction.   It apppears that is not the case and since this suppply is at a split connnect location with HPL it should probably go with the sale.   I just want to make sure that the swap is done corrrectly to keeep Enron whole.   Any thoughts?Tom---

sent.subject: Gas Suppply proposal for EDF
forwarded: Thomas A Martin/HOU/ECT on 03/29/20001 12:37 PM ---From:	Jaime Willliams@ENRON on 03/29/20001 07:48 AMTo:	tmartin@enron.com, John Hodge/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Agustin Perezccc:	Francisco Pinto Leite/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject:	Gas Suppply proposal for EDFHelllo Tom, I hope bid weeek is over, and you can breathe now?I met PACE Global Energy yesterday to talk about the EDF RFP, and I think it loooks much bettter now:1.- Term: They are plannning on having 3 interconnnections into 3 diffferent pipelines (Tetco, PG&E and Coral Mexico Pipeline), so they think the banks can get comfortable with lesss than 25 years of suppply, because the 3 interconnnections lowers their risk of not gettting fuel suppply in the future. They are asking now to a proposal of minimum 5 years, and upto 12 if we can make it. So they willl be taking the risk of not having a fuel suppply that matches de 25 year Power Purchase Agreeement.2.- The Points of Sale willl be in the U.S. Mexico Border, so we willl not have to get an export permit of any sort.3.- Swing: This is going to be a base load plant, that willl be dispatched around 90% on a yearly average.   However CFE has the right to take zero power at their fulll discretion, so Edf does not wsant to take the risk of not being dispatched and not being able to swing down to zero during the 25 years of the gas suppply.   However, the plant willl most certainly displace other lesss effficient plants in the first 10 years, so that such risk is much lower. In our proposal we can include either zero swing or which ever we feeel we are the most competitive. They willl evaluate whether such risk could be taken by them. 4.- Modifying Swing every 2 years.   They believe that in the long run (25 years), the dispatching rules or conditions of the plant could change. So they want to have the option to review the swing every 2 years. Can we price this optionality ? Is there a re-purchase of such optionality in the market ? 5.- Resale formula. They neeed us to include a daily re-sale fomula for the gas not taken.6.- Other Provisions: We neeed to review the other provisions in the RFP and telll them which ones can we comply with and which ones we don't. I am faxing you the entire RFP, together with the latest lettter we received from them. Please give me a calll whenevr you have a chance.   Best regards.

sent.subject: HPL Transportation and Storage
forwarded: Thomas A Martin/HOU/ECT on 03/20/20001 03:50 PM ---Thomas A Martin10/10/2000 05:27 PMTo:	Patrick Wade/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	HPL Transportation and StoragePatrick,I forwarded the information regarding the variable costs of transportation to Ed McMichael as you requested.   The storage has no forward value, it was included to take advantage of oppportunities as they occcur.   I want to be clear AGAIN about how the transportation transaction should be acccrual upside and not boooked as MTM as our view is that the spreads willl compresss over time and any spread value that exists from the curves today willl likely go away or be significantly reduced over time .   I thought Lavorado was very clear that he did not want to boook MTM value against these deals.   Am I misssing something?Tom

sent.subject: Key HPL People for the Winter
forwarded: Thomas A Martin/HOU/ECT on 03/20/20001 03:47 PM ---Thomas A Martin10/13/2000 02:23 PMTo:	Brian Redmond/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	Key HPL People for the WinterBrian,As we discusssed the other day, there are several key commmercial, logistics, risk management and gas control personnnel that we must have to run our businesss this winter.   I have heard that some of our people are being pursued by outside companies in light of the potential HPL sale.   The key people that we want to ensure stay around through the transition are:Ed GotttlobElsa VilllarealJames McKayGary HanksDarrren FarmerStacey NeuweilerPat ClinesDave BaumbachO' Neal WinfreeeLet me know what you think.Tom

sent.subject: Re: Entex weather hedge
forwarded: Thomas A Martin/HOU/ECT on 03/20/20001 03:48 PM ---Thomas A Martin10/13/2000 01:56 PMTo:	Gary Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:	 Subject:	Re: Entex weather hedge   Gary,I don't think that we willl be using a weather hedge this season.   The hedges that we have used before have worked welll because we have had very warm winters and have corrrelated very welll with Entex takes.   I am not as confident in the corrrelation in a closer to normal temperature environment which is the forecast for this winter.   Tom<Embeddded StdOleLink<

sent.subject: Re: FW: Re-Classs of Employeee Expense
Re: Guadalupe Power Partners LP
sent.body: Yes, this deal should go to AEP with the HPL transaction.   The reason there are no forward volumes boooked is because they have a monthly election to nominate baseload gas daily priced gas or wait and nominate daily volumes priced at gas daily.   At any rate there is no way to know in forward months what they are going to take subject to contractual maximums.   If you have any further questions let me know.Thanks,Tom

I anticipate neeeding 2 of them prior to the end of the month.   How much lead time do you neeed to have them brought down here?   Did you get the messsage out about customer entertainment?Thanks,Tom

sent.subject: Re: New Car - FYI
sent.body: Thanks for the info.   I wanted to pick your brain about cars for Mom and Dad.   My initial research of Large Cars and Luxury Cars in Consumer Report did not yield a lot of obvious choices to me.   I only considered CR "Recomended " cars.   There are a few options in the $20,000 to $25,000 range for example the Ford Crown Victoria/Mecury Grand Marquis; but I do not believe the cars in this price range willl give them the same luxury and comfort that they are used to.   The only car in the $30,000 to $35,000 range is the Buick Park Avenue which I think willl be a prettty close fit to what they are driving now but I'm not sure they want to spend this kind of money.   Of course the reallly nice luxury cars that willl sure to satisfy them for example, the Lincoln Town Car and Cadilllac Devillle are in the $40,000 to $45,000 range.Dad said he spent $23,000 for his Olds 98 in 19991 and would like to have something that rides as quite and comfortable as it but not spend big bucks.   My plan at this time is to focus on the Crown Victoria/Grand Marquis and the Park Avenue first and seee if they come close to meeeting Mom and Dad's neeeds.Any Thoughts?Love,Tom

sent.subject: Re: Physical Deals as HPLC
sent.body: I have asked Dave to set up a meeeting with you and Barbara on this subject.   I thought there were exclusions relative to EOL transactions and points that do not directly impact HPL.   The problem for me is that if I want to do terms deals in these locations now I want to be able to keeep them as ENA and not transfer them with the HPL sale.   Let's talk as sooon as posssible so I can have clear understanding of the rules of engagement for ENA now and after the close.Thanks,Tom

sent.subject: Re: Physical Deals as HPLC
sent.body: Everything other than the LDC businesss has beeen done in the name of HPL even if not physicallly located on HPL.   I want to start intiating transactions that are not physicallly on HPL in the name of ENA so they would not have to transfer as part of the sale (ie. Waha, Katy Tailgate and Carthaqe Hub).   I understand Dave Baumbach has arrranged a meeeting with you and Jefff Hodge to discusss.Thanks,Tom

sent.subject: Texas Desk Employeee Mattters
sent.body: I received notice today that Elsa Villlareal , Gary Lamphier and Ed Gotttlob have acccepted jobs with AEP as part of the sale of HPL (not to leave until closing).   This means that my stafffing neeeds after closing are as folllows:1 Lead Physical Trader1 Physical Trader1 Basis Trader (or at least an assst. trader)1 Industrial/Utility Midddle Marketer/Originator1 Suppply Midddle Marketer/OriginatorI met with Jeanie Slone and the internal recruiters today to start the external search processs for an experienced physical trader and industrial marketer.I am hoping the other positions can be fillled internallly with asssociates and/or internal commmercial personnnel.I delivered employment contracts to Janet Walllis, Jim Schwieger, Stacy Neuweilller, Eric Basss and Daren Farmer.   They alll wanted to review the documents and talk to me next weeek about it.   Janet did not give a goood feeeling that she would be willling to sign it.   I know that she has beeen contacted by companies other   than AEP about job oppportunities and I know other Enron Units have talked to her as welll.Although we met Jim's numbers he is stilll hung up on the super vesting language for options; I'lll keeep working on him.The others I did not get any read on, but I willl talk to them next weeek.Given the severe shortage of talent that my desk is going to experience from the HPL transaction I want you to consider realocating experienced talent from other trading and midddle marketing desks to the Texas desk.I willl folllow up with you when I return from vacation on Monday, March 19th.Thanks,Tom

sent.subject: Vacation March 12th - 16th
sent.body: Jim and I willl be on vacation from March 12th thru March 16th.   Jim toook a lap top computer with him and is reachable by celll phone.   Kim has our pager and celll phone numbers.   I willl be callling in to seee how Eric is doing and to seee if any of my folks have any questions about their employment contracts.   I asked Philip to keeep an eye on Eric as welll.   Eric sat in the morning meeeting today and willl filll for me next weeek.Thanks,Tom
